column1: # Title: H2A non-energy costs of hydrogen production technologies
# Source: H2A is the DOE EERE Hydrogen program's analysis model (https://www.hydrogen.energy.gov/h2a_analysis.html). H2A 2018 (generally)
column2: Results tab (2008 for nuclear thermal splitting)

column1: # Comments: Non-energy cost = required selling price - feedstock costs. Max improvement = improvement_to_2040 + 10%

column10: H2A 2018 did not report Biomass + CCS assumptions.
H2A 2018 did not report Coal without CCS assumptions.
H2A  2018 did not report future Coal + CCS assumptions.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis powered by solar PV created electricity. Electrolyzer costs only are provided here, assuming a capacity factor of 20% (matching solar panels).
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis powered by wind created electricity. Electrolyzer costs only are provided here, assuming a capacity factor of 46% (matching wind turbines).
Non-energy cost = required selling price. Source: H2A 2008.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis - Forecourt model for larger (1500kG/H2/day) plant.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis - Forecourt model for larger (1500kG/H2/day) plant.
